txt.en: 'What could her 'gift' possibly be?'
'I did not want to unleash it just yet, but it should be potent enough to end the likes of you.'
'The Orcs will finally have no master! We will be free to forge our own destiny!'
'I think we're going to have to go through these tunnels. Hopefully they lead through to the other side.'
'We can't stop now! Loknashra must still be in here somewhere!'
Talk to Kyrstig
Defeat the risen dwarf-lords
TBD
Defeat Loknashra
'At last, you have arrived!'
Defeat the wight of Vethúg Wintermind
'Drat, the hobgoblins block our way with ice! It will take too long to break through this!'
'I command you to rise, Vethúg Wintermind! You will be the instrument of my vengeance!'
'And once we're finished with the dwarves, it will be time for a family reunion.'

Deep in the Pit of Stonejaws, a grand tomb holds the remains of the many ancient dwarf-lords of Gundabad. The necromancer Loknashra, now empowered with the spirit of Drugoth, has returned to raise an army and claim her vengeance upon all those who wronged her.
'Why does it keep getting worse? These four look tough!'
'The brave heroes rush to stop the villain's evil plan. You've done it time and time again.'
'How amusing that the dwarves will meet their end at the hands of their own dead ancestors!'
'Oh no. That couldn't possibly be...?'
'I think we need to hurry. I saw Loknashra come in here, and she's no doubt already begun her villainy.'
Defeated the wight of Vethúg Wintermind
'Argh! You have impressed me yet again, [placeholder]! But I will not fall here.'
'Kergrim!'
Use the summoning horn to call Kyrstig

'That hobgoblin was formidable enough before she possessed the spirit of a Gauntlord in addition to her own! I think we need to hurry. I definitely saw Loknashra come in here, and she has no doubt already set to work disturbing the rest of my ancestors. Come on, let's go! Be brave, Kyrstig, be brave!'
'Come with me, if you dare!'
'We rest... once more....'
'I have one last gift for you, heroes.'
'Rise again.... stand together.... destroy... our enemies....'
'Come on, let's go! Be brave, Kyrstig, be brave!'
'But YOU, [placeholder], taking your head will be enough for one day's work.'
'You will not meet your end here, Loknashra.'
'But what you fail to see is that I will be the hero of MY people.'
'But they're really creepy... who dug these? Surely not dwarves.'
'They are coming, my sisters! We must complete the ritual now!'
'They will celebrate your death, [placeholder], and I will lead them into a grand future.'
'NO! I will have my vengeance or perish in the attempt!'
Defeated the risen dwarf-lords
'I feel sick. I swear, if I see one more desecrated corpse...'
'You're still alive?'
Defeated Loknashra
'You have been a thorn in my side since I set foot in Gundabad. Of course I knew you would come.'
'Do we dare? We must, right?'
Pick up the summoning horn
'I hope we can do this on our own. That hobgoblin was formidable enough before she possessed the spirit of a Gauntlord in addition to her own!'
'It can't... end... this way....'
'Enjoy your meaningless victory while you can, mortals.'
'Ugh. More ice. That means more creepy tunnels.'
'Uh oh.'
Rise again... stand together... destroy... our enemies....
'Not all of the dwarf vermin, I see. Too bad. I should have liked to claim Ausma and Hórin's beards as well.'
'I shall keep this host awhile longer.'
'I will use the Gauntlord's power to free them from the dragon's control, and I will save them from their most hated enemies: your invading army.'
'Come on, let's get this over with.'
'I think we're going to have to fight our way out!'
'You knew we would come?'
Find and speak to Kytstig at the entrance of The Houses of Rest.
'I am impressed. Truly. But now, you will die.'
'What am I saying? Of course I will. We're after a necromancer.'
'Drugoth is with me, and you cannot stand against our combined power!'
Adkhât-zahhar, the Houses of Rest -- Solo
'Uh oh!'
'She's... gone? Does that mean we won?'
